Html:
Hi,

I'm using bing maps for my application.

I requested an API-key for Bingmaps and i added the key like this: 

 

     
 this.MainMap.MapProvider = GMapProviders.BingSatelliteMap;
             
 GMapProviders.BingSatelliteMap.ClientKey = "ArcSxBOLgAoMVrhEIYYFOVEhXXXXXft6N_9vKWqHlKpkufXXXXXXXjJNY1m";

 

( http://greatmaps.codeplex.com/discussions/278030 )

However, when i check the usage of my key after running my application, there is no usage data.

"No data found for the Usage Report for Account Id :1XXX597 ( from 6/17/2012 to 7/17/2012)." 

Am i doing something wrong, or am i forgetting someting?
figure it out and post the answer, thanks ;}

The issue is that the Bing Maps implementation in this project is incorrect and will likely break in the future. Here is an outline of how authentication should be used for Bing Maps in this app:

Adding Bing Maps as a tile layer in a non-Bing Maps control can be done as outlined in this document. It should be noted that the tile URLs for Bing Maps change regularly and as such directly accessing tiles from a hardcoded URL is not allowed. It should also be noted that Bing Maps data cannot be integrated with competing mapping platforms as noted in the terms of use here: http://www.microsoft.com/maps/product/terms.html

In order to access the Bing Maps tiles in a supported way you will first need to get the current tile URL's from the Bing Maps Imagery REST service every time your application starts. The main purpose of this is to ensure your application is using the latest tile URLs, helps to prevent your application from breaking, and gives us the ability to track the usage of the service. The Bing Maps REST service is the preferred service to use to get the imagery metadata as it is much faster than the SOAP services and will allow your application to start up faster. Documentation on this service can be found here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff701716.aspx If you need to use this service from .NET, see the documentation here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj819168.aspx. Making a request to the imagery service like this:

http://dev.virtualearth.net/REST/V1/Imagery/Metadata/Road?output=json&include=ImageryProviders&key=BingMapsKey

This will return a response that contains an Image URL property. This URL will look something like this:

http://ecn.{subdomain}.tiles.virtualearth.net/tiles/r{quadkey}.jpeg?g=129&mkt={culture}&shading=hill&stl=H

You can then replace the different parts of the URL to create each tile. The subdomain can be a value of t0, t1, t2, t3. Using a different one for each tile request you can increase performance by get around browser URL request limits i.e. many browsers allow up to 8 concurrent requests to the same domain. Using subdomains allows up to 8 requests per subdomain. The culture value can be any value that is documented under the imagery section here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh441729.aspx The quadkey value can be calculated based on the zoom level and the tile you wish to render. Information on the tile system along with some useful code can be found here:

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb259689.aspx
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa940990.aspx

In addition to this, the query will also return information on the imagery providers and copyright information which should be displayed with the imagery.
Licensing queries can be sent here: http://www.microsoft.com/maps/contact-us.aspx

p.s. it's still unclear if session key should be used with tiles, tile metadata service doesn't include key in the response, and openlayers/leaflet doesn't add it, so ;/ ?

..anyway i've left default key enabled by default, but anyone can set and use their own for sure.

Adding the session key to the actual tile URLâ€™s is optional for the time being. This may change in the future if the service needs to be locked down more. Open layers and leaflet use the session key to get the base tile URL when the maps load. This is a requirement when accessing the tiles directly.

would adding key to tile url reflect in statistics Today?

is it required for 'official' access Today?

p.s. just created bing key and tested it, got:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Report xsi:schemaLocation="UsagesReportByCategory http://cloudcrmphxsrs/ReportServer?%2FBingMapsPlatform_MSCRM%2FUsagesReportByCategory&rs%3ACommand=Render&rs%3AFormat=XML&rs%3ASessionID=fclhhnmjshk5xe45fbodie31&rc%3ASchema=True" Name="UsagesReportByCategory" TxtAccountId="AccountID: 1358595" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="UsagesReportByCategory"><tblBilling2><Group2_Collection><Group2 ApplicationName="STV" TotalTransactionUsage="26.500" TotalPercentageOfTransactionUsage="1"><Detail_Collection><Detail ApiName="LoadStandardMap" BillType="Billable" TransactionCount="26.500" PercentageOfUsage="1" /></Detail_Collection></Group2></Group2_Collection></tblBilling2><ApiTotal><Transaction_x0020_Count Label="Transaction Count"><ApiNames_Collection><ApiNames Label="LoadStandardMap-Billable" DataValue0="26.500" /></ApiNames_Collection></Transaction_x0020_Count></ApiTotal><tblBilling TotalTransactionCount="26.500" TotalPercentageOfTransaction="1"><Detail_Collection><Detail ApiName="LoadStandardMap" BillType="Billable" TransactionCount="26.500" PercentageOfUsage="1" /></Detail_Collection></tblBilling></Report>
..i just loaded the map, zoom a bit and thats it, so i guess it works

"Anytime a map tile URL is used to download a map tile using a Bing Maps Key, the download is logged. For every eight (8) map tiles that are downloaded, one transaction is counted."

so it means there was 26*8=208 tiles downloaded?

..anyway, i've added and option ForceSessionIdOnTileAccess so it's now possible to use session key if required or in the mean time until metadata service doesn't include that

..i did few geocoding requests, but there isn't any in reports, or i have to reach some number to see them?
It will show up as a non-billable transaction if it is added to the tile URL in the reports. It isnâ€™t needed on the the individual tile URLâ€™s at this time.
